title: Man's Hat, 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk, silver foil wound around silk core and in flat strips
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading)
creditline: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf
description: Tall mens cap with deep flaring border in salmon-colored ribbed silk, brocaded with all-over floral design in silver; symmetrical bouquet brocaded in silks in soft blue, green, yellow, pink, and white at center front.

tombstone.epitaph:
Man's Hat, 18th century.
18th century. Medium: silk, silver foil wound around silk core and in flat strips
Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary wefts (brocading). Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf. 1952-47-2.
